segment.source: How to Run the Crash Analyzer in Stand-alone Mode on a Computer Other than an End-user Computer
segment.target: How to Run the Crash Analyzer in Stand-alone Mode on a Computer Other than an End-user Computer

segment.source: How to Run the Crash Analyzer in Stand-alone Mode on a Computer Other than an End-user Computer
segment.target: How to Run the Crash Analyzer in Stand-alone Mode on a Computer Other than an End-user Computer

segment.source: How to Run the Crash Analyzer in Stand-alone Mode on a Computer Other than an End-user Computer
segment.target: How to Run the Crash Analyzer in Stand-alone Mode on a Computer Other than an End-user Computer

segment.source: If you cannot access the Microsoft Debugging Tools for Windows or the symbol files on the end-user computer, you can copy the dump file from the problem computer and analyze it on a computer that has the stand-alone version of Crash Analyzer installed, such as a help desk computer that contains Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT) 10.
segment.target: If you cannot access the Microsoft Debugging Tools for Windows or the symbol files on the end-user computer, you can copy the dump file from the problem computer and analyze it on a computer that has the stand-alone version of Crash Analyzer installed, such as a help desk computer that contains Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT) 10.

segment.source: To run Crash Analyzer in stand-alone mode, you copy the memory dump file from the problem computer and analyze it on another computer, such as a help desk computer, that has the Crash Analyzer installed.
segment.target: To run Crash Analyzer in stand-alone mode, you copy the memory dump file from the problem computer and analyze it on another computer, such as a help desk computer, that has the Crash Analyzer installed.

segment.source: To run the Crash Analyzer in stand-alone mode
segment.target: To run the Crash Analyzer in stand-alone mode

segment.source: On a computer that has DaRT 10 installed, click Start, type Crash Analyzer, and then click Crash Analyzer.
segment.target: On a computer that has DaRT 10 installed, click Start, type Crash Analyzer, and then click Crash Analyzer.

segment.source: Follow the steps in the wizard, as described in How to Run the Crash Analyzer on an End-user Computer.
segment.target: Follow the steps in the wizard, as described in How to Run the Crash Analyzer on an End-user Computer.
